alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otero, southeastern Dona Ana and northwestern El Paso Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 539 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary near Fort Bliss. Gusty winds can be expected with this weather feature as it moves west. HAZARD...Wind gusts up of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, East El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Chaparral, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Sunland Park, Canutillo, Westway, Fort Bliss, Vinton, La Union, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal, Biggs Field, Fort Bliss Northeast and Franklin Mountains State Park. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
